manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: London Fog has been manufacturing quality men's and women's rainwear and outerwear since 1923. For over three generations, we have produced styles utilizing fabrications that are meant to be worn in all climates and weather. Our goal is to keep you warm and dry. Our heritage reflects our attention to design and details. When you purchase a London Fog product, it is more than a coat, it is an investment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Blast from the Past
reviews.reviewText: I'm so pleased with my new black London Fog. This line was very popular when I was young and it was great to see it offered again. The fit is perfect, the length is perfect, it's just about as classy as it comes, and at a great price. If you want an elegant rain coat - buy this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The coat is made very well quality fabric and professional sewing . Nice length for my height 5 ‘ 6 inches. Great weather coat for Wisconsin weather.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LONDON FOG Women's Single Breasted Long Trench Coat with Epaulettes and Belt Br Khaki
reviews.reviewText: This is a beautiful long trench coat. The lining is the same color as the coat. I am 5'10 and 150 pounds and the medium fits me perfect. I have been looking for a long trench coat for a while, I am so glad I found this one.I highly recommend this coat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall great purchase
reviews.reviewText: Loved everything about this coat. It is snug in the arms for me but I have that issue often. Other than that great silhouette, very flattering, great quality fabric that looks Chic. From the pictures I thought the buttons would look cheap but in person they are actually very nice and look much darker than in the pictures. Overall great purchase, looks very chic and it’s actually warm. The pictures don’t do it justice. If you’re thinking about it….. order it. For perspective I’m 5’5, 220 and ordered a XL which is my usual size in coats. It sits right above my ankles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality made item
reviews.reviewText: I’ve always wanted to London fog raincoat, and snatched this one up when it went on sale. It is extremely well-made, lightweight and fits beautifully-even with my “full figure “! Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like the style and quality of the coat not to mention how quick it arrived.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A little small
reviews.reviewText: This coat is very nice but not for me. It's too thick which made it feel tight. I prefer a loose fitting coat. If you live in a colder climate, I would recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm a longstanding London Fog customer
reviews.reviewText: This Amazon London Fog store is genuine; it does not sell fakes. I know London Fog products well, having bought many for years. This coat is the real deal. Do not hesitate to buy. I just got mine in black, size medium. It arrived in 3 days. I normally order from the manufacturer's own website, but they were out of black maxi trenches. They have this one in a lovely rose color that is tempting, but I wanted black. I had to replace my 8-year-old London Fog Juliet coat that I accidently scorched while pressing. I also tore my 6-year-old tan Sophie coat. Bad luck! Sad face! :-( Those coats had plaid felt zip-out warmers which were nice. Unfortunately, London Fog retired the styles with warmers. The quality of this exterior shell and the details are the same as before. The material resembles shiny black silk trench coats from high end manufacturers. This is not a cheap look; do not pay attention to the naysayers. I usually wear US size 10-12, and I am 5 feet 6 inches. The medium fits just fine with sweaters underneath, although I would not wear my bulkiest one. There is more room in the arms and shoulders than my old Juliet coat, probably because the lining is black satin and no warmer to take up extra room. The length is about 3/4 of my height. It does not reach the ground and no hemming is necessary. I hope London Fog stays in business because I love their coats. They had some financial difficulties during the pandemic, and I hope they recover fully to stay in business.

I will be getting a LOT of use out of this coat. Very well made trench. Great lines. Looks as pictured. Came folded up in a soft pouch and was NOT wrinkly in the least once opened.I am one of those athletic body builder women I’m 5’10, broad shouldered with muscular arms, 43 chest 35 waist I’ve a sturdy, statuesque figure and can wear a fleece under this XL trench with no issues.I agree that this cut and style is ideal for taller frames. Very flattering and classic works with any business or casual look I have and is a length not often found at this price point. Total winner.

Wow, das ist mal ein Mantel, dem man die gute Qualität ansieht. Ich trage normalerweise eine 40, hier passt mir eine S richtig gut. Bei meiner Größe von 1,64 m ist mir der Mantel bis an die Knöchel gegangen, ich habe ihn nun zum Kürzen zum Schneider gebracht. Das Kürzen kostet ca. 2/3 von dem, was der Mantel ursprünglich kostete, aber das ist ja klar: die Qualität ist derart hochwertig, dass auch eine Änderung aufwendig ist, weil es eben nicht nur eine Naht ist, die geändert werden muss. Auch wenn der Mantel dadurch wesentlich teurer am Ende ist: er ist es wert. Sehr zufrieden mit meinem Kauf!
Gorgeous classic trench, detachable hood, very well made. I'm 5 foot 8", 160lbs and the large fits perfectly with room for a chunky knit sweater. Mid calf length. Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 3, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This is a nicely weighted coat. The outer shell is a cotton-polyester mix. With a satin-twill lining, in a light blue colour.At 5.3" this trench coat is long on me, from the hem to the floor there is a clearance of apx 16cm.The sleeves are also long which is great, as I thought they looked a little short on the model.The coat also has a rather long belt, at apx 175cm; I can wrap it around myself twice or attempt those fancy belt tying techniques. The belt also has a cleverly hidden fastening, which means the belt will never accidentally slide out of the loops.As for the hood, I would describe it as adequate. If you have lots of hair as I do, you'll need an umbrella if caught in a shower as it doesn't quite cover my head. However, if I'm feeling a bit noir I may just wear a scarf.All in all, I'm very happy with this coat as I wanted a maxi-length trench. So, for me, this is perfect for both Spring and Autumn.
Very elegant and classic! Loved it
